alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 24 at 10:21PM CDT until June 24 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR EASTERN CEDAR...SCOTT...NORTHERN MUSCATINE AND SOUTHERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 1020 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Calamus to near Stockton to near Sweetland Center, moving east at 40 mph. The most intense part of these storms are near Interstate 80. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Rock Island, Bettendorf, Clinton, Durant, Eldridge, DeWitt, Camanche, Le Claire, West Liberty, Wilton, Walcott, Blue Grass, Buffalo, Princeton, Long Grove, Lowden, Wheatland, Cordova and Grand Mound. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
